title: How to Choose a Baby Nursery Theme

steps.headline: Decorate your nursery around a favorite storybook or film character.
steps.description: A theme is a great option for a gender-neutral nursery. Many parents decide to create a baby nursery theme around a favorite character from children's literature or film. You can search for infant bedding that features a beloved character and then choose paint colors that will correspond with this theme. If you can’t find decorations with the specific character, look for decorations that remind you of the feeling of the book or film. For instance, if you are using The Jungle Book, look for rainforest-themed objects. If you are inspired by Harry Potter, you can look for castles, owls, cats, or wizards. Be sure to choose a theme that will last for a few years as the baby grows.

steps.headline: Use travel as an inspiration.
steps.description: Think about the favorite places you have traveled or your dream destination. You can incorporate elements of these places into the nursery through artwork, animals, or landmarks. Make the theme baby-friendly by using soft materials and bright colors. For instance, a favorite beach could inspire a blue color scheme. A travel theme can be a simple as adding pictures from past trips or photographs of famous landmarks. You can also look for map-print bedding or include pieces that come from different countries such as furniture, fabric, or lamps. Consider including a mural of a special place or favorite landmark.

steps.headline: Look for fabric, toys, and rugs that represent your favorite sport.
steps.description: Sports are a great theme to create a fun nursery around. Choose furniture that is either neutral or is reminiscent of your inspiration. For instance, paint the furniture the colors of your favorite sports team. The team colors can even become your color theme. Sports memorabilia, such as tennis rackets, baseball bats, or jerseys can be hung as artwork. Sports balls or pictures of your favorite athlete can serve as decoration. Sports themes aren’t just for boys! You could do a ballet, gymnastics, or volleyball theme for a little girl’s room, for example.

steps.headline: Use your hobbies as a theme.
steps.description: Like using a sports theme, incorporating your favorite hobby is a great way to make a personalized nursery. Almost any hobby can be used to transform a baby's room. As an example, if you love gardening, consider floral fabrics or stenciling plants onto furniture. If you are a collector, consider using part of your collection in the nursery. Continue the theme on the walls and in the fabric print.

steps.headline: Choose your favorite animal.
steps.description: Animals are a classic theme for baby rooms. Think about your favorite animal, real or imaginary, and base your room around it. Bears, dogs, cats, dragons, and unicorns are all popular themes. Look for bedding, curtains, lamps, or rugs with your favorite animal. Use stickers or a mural of the animal on the wall. You can also use multiple animals as a theme. For instance, you could choose a woodland theme and incorporate deer, rabbits, and birds. A savanna theme could include giraffes, zebras, and lions. An animal theme can also be combined with the travel theme. Use animals from your favorite travel destination and include them in the room.

steps.headline: Go with a nighttime theme.
steps.description: If you love the nighttime, then use it as your inspiration; it is a great way to create a tranquil, classic space. Stars, comets, and moons can be stenciled onto walls or furniture. You can also look for nighttime-inspired bedding or toys. Avoid making the space dark and gloomy. To create a positive feel, focus on the stars and choose light-colored items.

steps.headline: Opt for a sun or rainbow theme.
steps.description:
A sun or morning theme creates a happy, energetic room. Use reds, yellows, and oranges as accents, and look for rainbow-print or sun-print fabrics and bedding.. 
Rainbows, suns, and clouds can also be stenciled onto walls or furniture. Or frame pictures of the sky, sunrise, or rainbows and hang them as art. A rainbow rug is a great way to add color and incorporate the theme without overpowering the room.

steps.headline: Select a nautical theme.
steps.description: A nautical theme is a popular motif that never goes out of style. Use blues, grays, and whites as a color scheme. Look for fabric, bedding, and pillows that are water or boat-themed. Use pictures of sailors or boats as wall art, and incorporate rope or anchor accessories to extend the theme. Use brighter colors, like reds, to brighten up a nautical-themed nursery. Stripes work well with the nautical theme; consider including them in the fabrics or on the walls.

steps.headline: Use warm colors for visual stimulation.
steps.description: Colors like red, orange, and yellow make spaces feel cozy and dynamic. The energizing colors will help create an exciting space but you may want to consider using them as accents if you want a more relaxed feeling in your nursery. Pastel and muted colors create a soothing environment. Colors like bold, bright yellow or red are too vibrant and shouldn’t be used. If you choose warm colors, look for furniture, bedding and decor that will complement the colors. If you want to tone down the colors, look for neutral pieces to include in the room.

steps.headline: Select cool or pastel colors if you want a soothing space.
steps.description: Colors like blues, greens, grays, and pastels help to create a tranquil atmosphere. These shades are very popular in nurseries as many parents want a relaxing environment for their baby. Make sure you balance darker colors, especially dark blues and grays, with lighter shades to prevent the room from being overly gloomy. Look for lighter furniture or fabrics to help brighten the room while maintaining the peaceful feeling. EXPERT TIP																															Katherine Tlapa																Interior Designer								Katherine Tlapa is an interior designer, currently working as a Design Specialist for Modsy, a design service based in San Francisco. She also runs her own DIY Home Design blog, My Eclectic Grace. She received her BFA in Interior Architecture from Ohio University in 2016. Katherine Tlapa			Interior Designer				Katherine Tlapa, an interior designer, advises: "Calming and muted colors are best for a nursery. You want to create a space that is relaxing for them, so soft yellows, greens, blues, and pinks are all great. Balance it with white for a serene space."

steps.headline: Go for gender-neutral colors if you don't know your baby's gender.
steps.description: Stick to colors that will work well for both boys and girls. Greens, grays, yellows, and creams will work for either gender. Add pops of colors through accessories and bedding. These colors are also useful if you are planning on having more than one baby. This way, you will not have to redecorate the nursery if your next child is a different gender. For instance, choose black and white as the main colors and add pops of yellow. Or, add accents in pink or blue if you know the baby’s gender.

steps.headline: Base your decorating theme around a specific object or accessory.
steps.description: For example, if you find a mobile for your baby's crib that you love, take the mobile to a paint store and choose corresponding colors for the walls. Then, search for matching bedding and other accessories, which will make the mobile a focal point. Any favorite item, such as a picture, rug, or bedding can become the focal point around which you create your baby's nursery theme. You can create a theme around a family heirloom, such as a teddy bear.

steps.headline: Buy the furniture first if you don’t have another focal point.
steps.description: If you are struggling to come up with an object to use as a centerpiece, then concentrate on the furniture. The baby furniture is obviously crucial to the nursery, and it can set the tone for the room theme. Match the room decor to the furniture. For example, if you buy a modern crib, then keep the modern theme throughout the rest of the furniture and decor. Or if you choose a certain color furniture, use that color throughout the room.

steps.headline: Incorporate a mural instead of focusing on an object or furniture.
steps.description: Painting a mural is a good way to personalize any nursery. It will become the centerpiece, and it will set the tone for the rest of the room. Pick bedding, curtains, and decorations that continue the mural’s theme or complement its colors. As an alternative to hiring an artist to paint a mural, choose some wall decals that can easily be placed where you want them.

steps.headline: Consider using vinyl wall clings.
steps.description: These are an easy way to create a focal wall without painting. They can be purchased at most baby-supply stores or online at sites like Amazon. They attach to the wall like stickers, but are designed to be removed. Vinyl wall clings are easy to replace which makes them ideal for nurseries. When your child gets older and you want to redecorate, you can simply remove or replace the wall clings.
